Title: Optimization of debtor credit quality determining prediction using decision tree
Source title: International Journal of Advanced Trends in Computer Science and Engineering
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Girsang, A.S., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Abner, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Credit is the one of the biggest contributor to the bank profit, other than products and services, but credit can also become the biggest loss contributor to the bank if credit quality, which is called as collectability not maintained properly. Good credit growth and expansion is needed to be in line with credit quality improvement so the maximum profit could be generated. This research seek to answer these question, how quantitative and qualitative data inside system that use decision tree can optimalized credit quality determination on PT. XYZ. Algorithm that is used in the Decision Tree method is Iterative Dichotomizer Three (ID3). Some of the advantages of ID3 Algorithm which are it could create understandable predicition rules, more faster, and only need some attribute test until all data is classified. © 2020, World Academy of Research in Science and Engineering. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Bank; Credit scoring; Decision tree; Prediction
